revised_title: Polymeric Langmuir-Blodgett Films for Molecular Electronics
tldr: The article discusses the development of polymeric Langmuir-Blodgett films for potential applications in molecular electronics. Preformed polymers, such as vinyl-maleic anhydride alternating copolymers, are used to create stable and robust films with regular layer structures. These films have been used as submicrometre resists, for second harmonic generation, and electro-optic modulation.
